EDAspy.optimization.multivariate package¶

Submodules¶

EDAspy.optimization.multivariate.EDA_multivariate module¶

class EDAspy.optimization.multivariate.EDA_multivariate.EDAgbn(MAX_ITER, DEAD_ITER, data, ALPHA, BETA, cost_function, evidences, black_list, n_clusters, cluster_vars)¶

Bases: object

Multivariate Estimation of Distribution algorithm. Best individuals of each generation are selected and modelled by a Gaussian Bayesian network, from where new individuals are sampled. Some of the variables might be evidences (fixed values). The optimizer will find the optimum values of the non-evidences variables for those evidences. Also it is possible to control de influence of the historic (from which EDA is initialized) in the selection of the best indiviudals.

Parameters

  • MAX_ITER (int) – Maximum number of iterations of the algorithm

  • DEAD_ITER (int) – Number of iterations with no best cost improvement, before stopping

  • data (pandas dataframe) – data of the historic

  • ALPHA (float [0,1]) – percentage of population to select in the truncation

  • BETA (float [0,1]) – percentage of influence of the individual likelihood in the historic

  • cost_function (callable function which receives a dictionary as input and returns a numeric value) – cost function to minimize

  • evidences (two fold list. A list that contains list of size 2 with name of variable and value [name, value]) – name of evidences variables, and fixed values.

  • black_list (pandas dataframe with two columns (from, to)) – forbidden arcs in the structures

  • n_clusters (int) – number of clusters in which, the data can be grouped. The cluster is appended in each iteration

  • cluster_vars (list of strings) – list of names of variables to consider in the clustering

Raises

Exception – cost function is not callable

property best_cost_global¶
Returns

best cost found ever at the end of the execution

Return type

float

Returns

new_generation()¶

Build a new generation from the parameters calculated and update the generation to the new group of individuals

Returns

mean and sigma of the individuals costs of the generation

Return type

float, float

run(output=True)¶

Running method :param output: if desired to print the output of each individual. True to print output :type output: boolean :return:the class is returned, in order to explore all the parameters :rtype: self python class

sampling_multivariate(fit)¶

Calculate the parameters mu and sigma to sample from a multivariate normal distribution.

Parameters

fit (bnfit object from R) – bnfit object from R of the generation (structure and data)

Returns

name in order of the parameters returned. mu and sigma parameters of the multivariate normal distribution

Return type

list, float, float

soft_restrictions(NOISE)¶

Add Gaussian noise to the evidence variables

Parameters

NOISE (float) – std of the normal distribution from where noise is sampled

truncate()¶

Select the best individuals of the generation. In this case, not only the cost is considered. Also the likelihood of the individual in the initial generation. This influence is controlled by beta parameter

EDAspy.optimization.multivariate.EDA_multivariate_gaussian module¶

class EDAspy.optimization.multivariate.EDA_multivariate_gaussian.EDA_multivariate_gaussian(SIZE_GEN, MAX_ITER, DEAD_ITER, ALPHA, aim, cost_function, mus, sigma)¶

Bases: object

Multivariate Estimation of Distribution algorithm continuous. New individuals are sampled from a multivariate normal distribution. Evidences are not allowed

Parameters

  • SIZE_GEN (int) – total size of the generations in the execution of the algorithm

  • MAX_ITER (int) – total number of iterations in case that optimum is not yet found. If reached, the optimum found is returned

  • DEAD_ITER (int) – total number of iteration with no better solution found. If reached, the optimum found is returned

  • ALPHA (float [0-1]) – percentage of the generation tu take, in order to sample from them. The best individuals selection

  • aim ('minimize' or 'maximize'.) – Represents the optimization aim.

  • cost_function (callable function which receives a dictionary as input and returns a numeric) – a callable function implemented by the user, to optimize.

  • mus (pandas dataframe (one row)) – pandas dataframe with initial mus of the multivariate gaussian

  • sigma (pandas dataframe (one row)) – pandas dataframe with the sigmas of the variable (diagonal of covariance matrix)

Raises

Exception – cost function is not callable

check_generation()¶

Check the cost of each individual in the cost function implemented by the user

new_generation()¶

Build a new generation sampled from the vector of probabilities. Updates the generation pandas dataframe

run(output=True)¶

Run method to execute the EDA algorithm

Parameters

output (bool) – True if wanted to print each iteration

Returns

best cost, best individual, history of costs along execution

Return type

float, pandas dataframe, list

truncation()¶

Selection of the best individuals of the actual generation. Updates the generation by selecting the best individuals

update_vector()¶

From the best individuals update the vector of normal distributions in order to the next generation can sample from it. Update the vector of normal distributions
